reviews.text: I love Marriott hotels but not this one. This hotel is a bit dated and needs to be remodeled. That being said, it was clean, convenient to the airport and the staff was friendly. The worst part of the experience was these huge lights in the parking lot that shine into the hotel windows of the rooms facing the side lot. Even with the curtains fully closed the lights shined in around the side and if felt like you were sleeping during daylight. I can't understand why they wouldn't reposition these. I asked to be moved but they didn't have any other rooms available, however they did give me bonus Marriott points for my troubles.
reviews.title: Disappointing for a Marriott

reviews.text: I went to St Louis on a business trip for a large aerospace company with a large presence in St Louis. Worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. Rooms were tiny and smelled musty. Restaurant was terrible. They charge $9 per day for parking even if you are a guest, and $13 to use internet daily Its close to the airport and a good BBQ place, but other than that its aweful. I don't even care that the entire building is dated. I advised the company travel coordinator to not book the place ever again and on my next visit I stayed at a much nicer place for LESS.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel ever

reviews.text: Thanks to the Marriott staff for their outstanding service, hospitality, friendliness and kindness during a recent business stay.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with lovely service

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was perfect (with an abundance of items), the business concierge lounge was a great retreat with daily happy hour and desserts, and the room lacked for nothing.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in St. Louis

reviews.text: The free airport shuttle service was fantastic; could not have asked for better.
reviews.title: Not a good choice for business travellers

reviews.text: I have stayed at this location many times over the years and have watched it go slowly downhill. It seems they are trying to remodel, but it is surely not fast enough. And there is nothing they do NOT charge for. What hotel/motel does not have free internet now? You pay 13$ per day for it here...and 9$ to park every day...oh, and for years now, when you check out, the little machine on the parking lot to raise the release bar and let you out when it scans your ticket rarely works, which makes you go back inside yet again(I waited in line while everyone had to do this, including us). The elevators are so slow, it's frightening. The staff is very nice, and very friendly. The restaurant is horribly overpriced. You almost need a line of credit from a bank to take your family there for a meal, and that's not a joke, it's just fact. We go there out of habit and out of sentiment, but in the future we plan on going somewhere else...it's just gone down and down, and until they improve some things, we will not return. A shame, it was a wonderful place once, and could be, again.
reviews.title: Marriott needs to get with the program-it's 2010, not 1975!

reviews.text: First impression was that I was being greeted as a long term or returning guest even though I had never been there before. The rooms were clean and the hotel was older but well kept. Very close to rental car return.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff who make you feel very welcome

reviews.text: There was a music conference going on while I was there and they changed my room to a quieter area without any trouble. The only tip I would give people is that either the elevators were out of service or there just arent enough elevators for the building so ask for a lower floor so you can use the stairs.
reviews.title: I have a rash from here

reviews.text: If I go back to St. Louis I will stay there again.
reviews.title: Eric Smith won't help you get your pizza

reviews.text: Oh my goodness, this place is HORRIBLE! Please do not stay here. It was dirty, swamps of uncontrolled children. I got a rash from the bed or carpet. The room was NEVER clean. It took them hours to bring us towels, I actually left and came back to no towels! it was the worst hotel I have stayed in....Worst. It does not look like a Marriott, and they had the nerve to charge for parking. The doors are awkwardly placed to where you have to walk around the building to access the elevator, which too 5 minutes or more to come every time. We started using the stairs. They had bugs. and it is out dated in decor. If you want luxury or even normalcy Save your money or go else where.
reviews.title: A good airport hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Marriott St. Louis Airport for three nights when I was visiting a friend who lives nearby. During the Labor Day weekend, the hotel was pretty fully booked due to a convention, but the staff didn't seem to let it shake them and they were courteous and helpful throughout my stay.
reviews.title: A good, solid choice

reviews.text: I had lunch in the hotel restaurant once, and it was reasonably priced and had a good variety of choices. The room was well appointed and comfortable enough. It was a fairly typical Marriott stay, with no surprises.
reviews.title: Convenient and updated

reviews.text: Convenient location next to the airport.
reviews.title: Great AND Convenient to Lambert

reviews.text: Not too loud at night as airplane traffic tends to stop after 10-11 PM.
reviews.title: Good hotel...not sure it was worth the price

reviews.text: Price maybe a little steep at $189+, but the company paid so I wasn't concerned about that.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.text: Randomly picked hotel as location to the airport looked great.
reviews.title: Great location and price for girl's weekend!

reviews.text: Really pleased with the cleanliness of the room and value for the dollar. Opted to include breakfast with room rate and the restaurant was really yummy.
reviews.title: Nice rooms and friendly staff.

reviews.text: The pool was very clean and guests were very respectful of space and the relaxed atmosphere.
reviews.title: Dated but Good
Just OK
reviews.text: Overall, we would stay again!

I stayed here for one night when I had a quick turn-around in St. Louis. While the hotel is very dated looking, I found my room to be clean and comfortable. Also, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I was given a corner room and it was very quiet.
reviews.title: Large hotel, small but very clean rooms
